com.poesys.db.pk
Class PrimaryKeyFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.poesys.db.pk.PrimaryKeyFactory

public class PrimaryKeyFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A Factory Method pattern class containing factory methods for all the different kinds of primary keys. Use this factory to create a primary key in a data access object (DAO) or anywhere else you must create a key. Add methods here if you add new types of primary key.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Detail

createSingleNumberKey

public static NaturalPrimaryKey createSingleNumberKey(java.lang.String name,
                                                      java.math.BigInteger value,
                                                      java.lang.String className)
                                               throws DuplicateKeyNameException,
                                                      InvalidParametersException
Create a natural primary key from a name and an integer. This is a shortcut factory method for a common kind of natural primary key, a single integer value. A common use for this is for the second part of a composite primary key.

Parameters:
name - the column name for the primary key
value - the key value
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the primary key
Throws:
DuplicateKeyNameException - when the list contains more than one column with the same name
InvalidParametersException - when the list has no key columns

createNaturalKey

public static NaturalPrimaryKey createNaturalKey(java.util.List<AbstractColumnValue> list,
                                                 java.lang.String className)
                                          throws DuplicateKeyNameException,
                                                 InvalidParametersException
Create a primary key from a list of column values. The list comprises the columns of a natural key, a key built out of one or more columns supplied by the user.

Parameters:
list - the list of column values
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the primary key
Throws:
DuplicateKeyNameException - when the list contains more than one column with the same name
InvalidParametersException - when the list has no key columns

createGuidKey

public static GuidPrimaryKey createGuidKey(java.lang.String name,
                                           java.lang.String className)
                                    throws InvalidParametersException
Create a GUID primary key. The GUID is a generated globally unique identifier.

Parameters:
name - the name of the single key column
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the GUID primary key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the column name is null or GUID generation fails

createGuidKey

public static GuidPrimaryKey createGuidKey(java.lang.String name,
                                           java.lang.String guidString,
                                           java.lang.String className)
                                    throws InvalidParametersException
Create a GUID primary key using a queried GUID string. The GUID is a generated globally unique identifier. The GUID string is the string representation of a previously created GUID stored in the database.

Parameters:
name - the name of the single key column
guidString - the string representation of the GUID
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the GUID primary key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the column name is null or GUID generation fails

createIdentityKey

public static IdentityPrimaryKey createIdentityKey(java.lang.String name,
                                                   java.lang.String className)
                                            throws InvalidParametersException
Create a primary key suitable for later value generation using an identity column, a column that auto-generates a unique integer key when you insert a row. The DAO must finalize the insert by calling that method on the Identity Primary Key.

Parameters:
name - the column name of the identity column
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the primary key with a zero (0) value
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the name is null

createIdentityKey

public static IdentityPrimaryKey createIdentityKey(java.lang.String name,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger value,
                                                   java.lang.String className)
                                            throws InvalidParametersException
Create a primary key from previously generated data, such as a key queried from the database, for an identity column, a column that auto-generates a unique integer key when you insert a row.

Parameters:
name - the column name of the identity column
value - the previously generated identity value
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the primary key with the specified value
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the name is null

createOracleSequenceKey

public static SequencePrimaryKey createOracleSequenceKey(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                         java.lang.String sequenceName,
                                                         java.lang.String name,
                                                         java.lang.String className)
                                                  throws InvalidParametersException,
                                                         NoPrimaryKeyException,
                                                         java.sql.SQLException
Create a primary key containing a value generated from a named Oracle SEQUENCE object. You must create the sequence in the target Oracle database and have it start with an appropriate value. The sequence name, if null, defaults to the key column name.

Parameters:
connection - the connection to the Oracle database
sequenceName - the name of the Oracle SEQUENCE object
name - the name of the single primary key column
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the sequence primary key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the name or sequence-generated value is null
NoPrimaryKeyException - when the sequence-generated value can't be generated, possibly because of a SQL error such as the wrong sequence name or because the sequence query failed to return a value, which should never happen
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem closing the SQL statement

createMySqlSequenceKey

public static SequencePrimaryKey createMySqlSequenceKey(java.sql.Connection connection,
                                                        java.lang.String sequenceName,
                                                        java.lang.String name,
                                                        java.lang.String className)
                                                 throws InvalidParametersException,
                                                        NoPrimaryKeyException,
                                                        java.sql.SQLException

Create a primary key containing a value generated from a table called mysql_sequence that simulates the Oracle SEQUENCE. The sequence name, if null, defaults to the key column name. You must use the value in the same transaction or the value is not guaranteed to be unique. Here is some JDBC code that creates the sequence table and initializes the sequence to 0. The ? parameter is the name of the sequence. 

 CREATE TABLE mysql_sequence (
   name varchar(30) NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
   value decimal(12) NOT NULL
 ) type=InnoDB;
 
 INSERT INTO mysql_sequence values (?, 0);
 
 UPDATE mysql_sequence
    SET value = value+1
  WHERE name = ?;
  
 SELECT value
   FROM mysql_sequence
  WHERE name = ?;

Parameters:
connection - the connection to the MySQL database
sequenceName - the name of the MySQL sequence
name - the name of the single primary key column
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the sequence primary key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the name or sequence-generated value is null
NoPrimaryKeyException - when the sequence-generated value can't be generated, possibly because of a SQL error such as the wrong sequence name
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a problem closing the SQL statement

createSequenceKey

public static SequencePrimaryKey createSequenceKey(java.lang.String name,
                                                   java.math.BigInteger value,
                                                   java.lang.String className)
                                            throws InvalidParametersException
Create a sequence key from a value. This method just creates the key using the name and value, it does not generate a new sequence value.

Parameters:
name - the key column name
value - the sequence value
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
a new sequence primary key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when the key name or value is null

createCompositeKey

public static CompositePrimaryKey createCompositeKey(IPrimaryKey parentKey,
                                                     IPrimaryKey subKey,
                                                     java.lang.String className)
                                              throws InvalidParametersException,
                                                     DuplicateKeyNameException
Create a composite primary key, a key comprising the key of the parent object that owns the identified object plus an additional key that identifies the object within a set of children of the parent object.

Parameters:
parentKey - the key of the parent (owning) object
subKey - the identifying value within the parent key
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the composite key
Throws:
InvalidParametersException - when there is no parent or sub-key
DuplicateKeyNameException - when there are multiple columns with the same name

createCompositeKey

public static CompositePrimaryKey createCompositeKey(java.lang.String parentColumnName,
                                                     java.math.BigInteger parentId,
                                                     java.lang.String childColumnName,
                                                     java.math.BigInteger childNumber,
                                                     java.lang.String className)
Create a composite primary key in the special but common case of a parent with a sequence key and a child with a number that identifies the child within the parent and provides an ordering of the children of the parent.

Parameters:
parentColumnName - the name of the parent key column
parentId - the parent key value
childColumnName - the name of the child number column
childNumber - the child number value
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
a composite primary key with an embedded sequence key for the parent and a natural key for the child.

createCompositeKey

public static CompositePrimaryKey createCompositeKey(java.lang.String parentColumnName,
                                                     java.lang.String parentId,
                                                     java.lang.String childColumnName,
                                                     java.math.BigInteger childNumber,
                                                     java.lang.String className)
Create a composite primary key in the special but common case of a parent with a GUID key and a child with a number that identifies the child within the parent and provides an ordering of the children of the parent.

Parameters:
parentColumnName - the name of the parent key column
parentId - the parent key value, a GUID as a string
childColumnName - the name of the child number column
childNumber - the child number value
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
a composite primary key with an embedded sequence key for the parent and a natural key for the child.

createAssociationKey

public static AssociationPrimaryKey createAssociationKey(java.util.List<IPrimaryKey> keys,
                                                         java.lang.String className)
                                                  throws DuplicateKeyNameException,
                                                         InvalidParametersException
Create an association key, a key comprising two or more keys of associated objects.

Parameters:
keys - a list of the primary keys of associated objects
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
the association primary key
Throws:
DuplicateKeyNameException - when there are multiple columns in the primary keys with the same name
InvalidParametersException - when the key has fewer than two nested primary keys

createAssociationKey

public static AssociationPrimaryKey createAssociationKey(java.util.List<IPrimaryKey> keys,
                                                         AssociationKeyMapping mapping,
                                                         java.lang.String className)
Create an association key, a key comprising two or more keys of associated objects, using input keys for the objects and a mapping to transform the column names from the objects into the column names of the association.

Parameters:
keys - the keys that comprise the association key
mapping - the mapping of column names
className - the name of the IDbDto class of the object that the primary key identifies
Returns:
a new association primary key
